required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Caffeinated Coffee on Intraocular Pressure
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Caffeinated Coffee on Intraocular Pressure

brief_summary.textblock: High intraocular pressure (IOP) is a known risk factor for developing primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG). There is controversy in the literature regarding the degree to which caffeine influences IOP, with some studies reporting minimal changes in IOP while others report up to 4 mmHg increases. To date there are no double-masked randomized controlled trials that examine acute caffeinated coffee's effects on IOP in patients with or at risk for primary open-angle glaucoma. The investigators aim to better understand the relationship between acute caffeinated coffee (vs decaffeinate coffee) consumption and IOP in a double-masked, crossover randomized controlled clinical trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Intraocular Pressure at 60 Minutes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to coffee ingestion (baseline), 60 minutes post coffee ingestion
primary_outcome.description: At the caffeinated coffee visit: Change in intraocular pressure at 60 minutes = intraocular pressure at 60 minutes post caffeinated coffee ingestion minus intraocular pressure at baseline prior to caffeinated coffee ingestion At the decaffeinated coffee visit: Change in intraocular pressure at 60 minutes = intraocular pressure at 60 minutes post decaffeinated coffee ingestion minus intraocular pressure at baseline prior to decaffeinated coffee ingestion

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Intraocular Pressure at 90 Minutes
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to coffee ingestion (baseline), 90 minutes post coffee ingestion
primary_outcome.description: At the caffeinated coffee visit: Change in intraocular pressure at 90 minutes = intraocular pressure at 90 minutes post caffeinated coffee ingestion minus intraocular pressure at baseline prior to caffeinated coffee ingestion At the decaffeinated coffee visit: Change in intraocular pressure at 90 minutes = intraocular pressure at 90 minutes post decaffeinated coffee ingestion minus intraocular pressure at baseline prior to decaffeinated coffee ingestion

arm_group.arm_group_label: Caffeinated Coffee 1st Visit, Decaffeinated Coffee 2nd Visit
arm_group.description: Participants will be given an 8 oz cup of caffeinated coffee on their first visit and 8 oz cup of decaffeinated coffee on their second visit.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Decaffeinated Coffee 1st Visit, Caffeinated Coffee 2nd Visit
arm_group.description: Participants will be given an 8 oz cup of decaffeinated coffee on their first visit and 8 oz cup of caffeinated coffee on their second visit.

intervention.description: Participants will drink one 8 oz cup in the morning hours. Participants have 15 minutes to drink the coffee but may do so in less time.
intervention.arm_group_label: Caffeinated Coffee 1st Visit, Decaffeinated Coffee 2nd Visit
Decaffeinated Coffee 1st Visit, Caffeinated Coffee 2nd Visit

intervention.description: Participants will drink one 8 oz cup in the morning hours. Participants have 15 minutes to drink the coffee but may do so in less time.
intervention.arm_group_label: Caffeinated Coffee 1st Visit, Decaffeinated Coffee 2nd Visit
Decaffeinated Coffee 1st Visit, Caffeinated Coffee 2nd Visit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 40-89 yrs
- POAG for cases or no forms of glaucoma for controls
- Willingness to drink coffee
- Consent signed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 40 or greater than 89 yrs
- all forms of glaucoma other than POAG
- any condition inappropriate for tonometry (ie corneal disease, LASIK)
- unable or unwilling to give consent
- unable or unwilling to drink coffee
- pregnancy

group.title: Caffeinated Coffee 1st Visit, Decaffeinated Coffee 2nd Visit
group.description: Participants drank an 8 oz cup of caffeinated coffee on the their first visit, and then an 8 oz cup of decaffeinated coffee on their second visit. The second visit was completed 2 days to 4 weeks after the first visit, depending on the participants' schedules. Participants did not ingest caffeine in any form starting from 12:01am the day of the visit until after the visit that day except for the study coffee we gave to them.

group.title: Decaffeinated Coffee 1st Visit, Caffeinated Coffee 2nd Visit
group.description: Participants drank an 8 oz cup of decaffeinated coffee on the their first visit, and then an 8 oz cup of caffeinated coffee on their second visit. The second visit was completed 2 days to 4 weeks after the first visit, depending on the participants' schedules. Participants did not ingest caffeine in any form starting from 12:01am the day of the visit until after the visit that day except for the study coffee we gave to them.

period.title: Time Between Visits (2 Days to 4 Weeks)

group.title: All Participants Who Completed Both Study Visits
group.description: Only those 106 participants who completed both study visits were included in baseline and final data analyses. The 6 participants who did not complete both study visits were not included in any baseline or final data analyses.

measure.title: Baseline Intraocular Pressure on Caffeinated Coffee Visit
measure.description: The intraocular pressure measured at baseline prior to ingestion of caffeinated coffee on the caffeinated coffee visit.

measure.title: Baseline Intraocular Pressure on Decaffeinated Coffee Visit
measure.description: The intraocular pressure measured at baseline prior to ingestion of decaffeinated coffee on the decaffeinated coffee visit.

outcome.title: Change in Intraocular Pressure at 60 Minutes
outcome.description: At the caffeinated coffee visit: Change in intraocular pressure at 60 minutes = intraocular pressure at 60 minutes post caffeinated coffee ingestion minus intraocular pressure at baseline prior to caffeinated coffee ingestion At the decaffeinated coffee visit: Change in intraocular pressure at 60 minutes = intraocular pressure at 60 minutes post decaffeinated coffee ingestion minus intraocular pressure at baseline prior to decaffeinated coffee ingestion
outcome.time_frame: Prior to coffee ingestion (baseline), 60 minutes post coffee ingestion
outcome.population: Only those 106 participants who completed both study visits were included in baseline and final data analyses. The 6 participants who did not complete both study visits were not included in any baseline or final data analyses.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: We gave subjects caffeinated coffee on one visit and decaffeinated coffee on the other visit. The changes in outcome parameters we observed (ie IOP changes) could be due to other non-caffeine components in the coffee.
